greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to 1 +- 3 +- 5 +- ... +- (2*n-1) == 0 mod n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000 (first 200 terms from Seiichi Manyama)
maple: b:= proc(n, i, m) option remember; `if`(i<1, `if`(n=0, 1, 0),
add(b(irem(n+j, m), i-2, m), j=[i, m-i]))
mathematica: Table[With[{s = Range[1, (2 n - 1), 2]}, Count[Map[Total[s #] &, Take[Tuples[{-1, 1}, Length@ s], -2^(n - 1)]], _?(Divisible[#, n] &)]], {n, 22}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 01 2018 *)
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Feb 28 2018
